batch_data.title: Virginia Giuffre, Prince Andrew and Jeffrey Epstein accuser, dies by suicide
batch_data.description: Giuffre alleged she was trafficked to the Duke of York when she was 17, which he has strenuously denied.

batch_data.title: Russia and Ukraine 'very close to a deal', says Trump
batch_data.description: The US president's envoy meets Vladimir Putin in Moscow, while Ukraine calls for more pressure on Russia.

batch_data.title: Pope wanted to work until the end, archbishop tells BBC
batch_data.description: In an exclusive interview with the BBC, Archbishop Paul Gallagher says Pope Francis preferred to "die with his boots on".

batch_data.title: Diddy lawyers argue 'swinger lifestyle' not a crime ahead of trial
batch_data.description: The rapper's attorneys say his sexual encounters were appropriate, and deny they amount to sex trafficking.

batch_data.title: Love on the Spectrum cast questions RFK Jr's comments about autistic people
batch_data.description: Robert F Kennedy said people with autism "will never pay taxes, they'll never hold a job, they'll never play baseball," in remarks that are now being criticised.
